item.title: Report E-2024080214
item.description:
Report E-2024080214

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-14T15:13:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 19, 2024, at 0938 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Dayton Freight Lines personnel in Des Plaines, Illinois regarding the release of PERMAFILÂ® 74035 (UN3082, Environmentally hazardous substance, liquid, n.o.s, 9, III). Contractors were dispatched and upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 55 gallons from (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted a 8ft x 20ft area of the trailer floor, and a 5ft x 10ft area of concrete. The damaged drum was placed in a 85-gallon overpack and contractors were able to clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DM's, and (1) 85-gallon DM which was then staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

RESPONDER ARRIVES AT THE SPILL WITH PPE ON, DECISION TREE, AND STOCKED SPILL CART. RESPONDER CONTAINS LEAKING PACKAGE AND OTHER LEAKED ON PACKAGES. CLEANS UP REST OF SPILL.

item.title: Report E-2024080147
item.description:
Report E-2024080147

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-01
  • City: Chicago
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SKYWEST AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Possible thermal runaway of a lithium ion battery occurred on flight AA 6271 ALB-ORD on 8/1/2024. CRJ 700 aircraft, N750SK During the flight the AFT Flight Attendant sat in her jumpseat. At some point during this action, her Electronic Flight Attendant Device (iPhone 12) slid from her pocket and into the gap behind the folding jumpseat. She stood up and realized the phone may have been crunched/damaged in the jumpseat. She noticed a crack in the device's screen. A few moments later she noticed the phone began to feel warm. She notified the FWD flight attendant of the issue. Together, they took the device to a galley ice tray and drowned the device in ice water and notified the flight deck. At that point, they realized they should be using the aircraft's fire containment bag. They moved the device to the fire containment bag and added more liquid to completely drown the device. Upon arrival into ORD, the fire containment bag containing the damaged device was handed off to a customer service agent. There were no further issues with the damaged device. PLEASE NOTE that the device DID NOT emit smoke, sparks, flames, or any gasses. This should be considered a possible dangerous evolution of heat.

  • Description: On July 26, 2024, at 1953 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Dayton Freight Lines personnel in East Moline, Illinois regarding the release of Closed Loop Treatment (UN1760, Potassium Hydroxide, 8, II). Terminal personnel reported that 2 gallons were released from (1) 5-gallon plastic pail and impacted the trailer floor. Terminal personnel cleaned the release, and placed all waste in (1) 15-gallon DF which was staged onsite pending disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080090
item.description:
Report E-2024080090

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-26
  • City: LISLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 26, 2024, at 1247 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Dayton Freight Lines personnel in Lisle, Illinois regarding the release of GF Clean 1052 (UN1760, Potassium Hydroxide, 8, II). Contractors were dispatched, and upon arrival confirmed the release of 5 gallons of GF Clean 1052 from (1) 55-gallon DF. The release impacted the trailer floor and a 20ft x 8ft area of concrete. Contractors transferred the remaining product into a new plastic drum, then cleaned the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080093
item.description:
Report E-2024080093

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 25, 2024, at 0628 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Dayton Freight Lines personnel in Des Plaines, Illinois regarding the release of Hercules Sizzle (UN1789, Hydrochloric acid solution, 8, II). Terminal personnel reported that .25 gallons were release from (1) 1-gallon plastic pail due to a load shift during transit and impacted the trailer floor. Terminal personnel cleaned the release and staged the waste onsite pending disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080092
item.description:
Report E-2024080092

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T15:13:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 19, 2024, at 1418 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Dayton Freight Lines personnel in Des Plains, Illinois regarding the release of approximately 2 gallons of 1447810 Gray Epoxy Paint (UN1263, 3, III) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. It was reported that terminal personnel placed the damaged drum in a 65-gallon metal overpack, then neutralized and cleaned the release. All waste was reportedly placed along with the damaged drum in the 65-gallon overpack and staged onsite for proper disposal.
